name: Mental Health Complexity Algorithm
verification_source: InterRAI BMHS Assessment Form - Custom derivation
description: Derives mental health complexity score from BMHS Section B (Disordered Thought) items. Higher scores indicate more complex mental health presentations requiring specialized support.

additive_items.rationale: Command hallucinations are safety-critical and indicate severe psychiatric presentation
No insight (value=2) indicates poor awareness of mental health issues
Abnormal thought process indicates cognitive/psychiatric disturbance

interpretation.0: No mental health complexity - standard care appropriate
interpretation.2: Moderate complexity - mental health support services recommended
interpretation.3: High complexity - specialized mental health services required
interpretation.4: Very high complexity - intensive psychiatric support needed
interpretation.5: Severe complexity - crisis-level intervention may be required
